page.title: 01Valley, West Longmynd Shrops
page.content: An area of scattered small farm communities, peaceful countryside with small fields and hedgerows. Predominately grazing land with sheep; and beef cattle replacing dairy cattle since milk quotas. Recently several small farms have been joined and farm cottages sold for holiday homes. A mobile library calls but people visit Shrewsbury, 11 miles or Bishops Castle, 7 miles, for shopping, doctor etc. There is a Saturday bus service. The tiny Methodist Chapel at Kinnerton has an organ but no electricity. They use calor gas. Services are n alternate Sunday afternoons. The Horse Shoe Inn at Ratlinghope, dating back to the 17th Century is a quiet, country pub, popular with summer visitors. Ratthinghope Youth Hostel, originally a school, opens most of the year with
